text: Lissolepis is a genus of mid-sized skinks (adult snout-vent length 100–130 mm) with a bulky angular body and small eyes. 20–28 rows of midbody scales; dorsal scales smooth. The nasal scale has a postnarial groove; the subocular scale row is complete. Eyelids similar in colour to the adjacent scales. (2008). "Molecular systematics of social skinks: phylogeny and taxonomy of the Egernia group (Reptilia: Scincidae)". Zool. J. Linn. Soc. 154 (4): 781-794. (HTML abstract). They were previously placed in the genus Egernia. ==Species== * Lissolepis coventryi (Storr, 1978) – eastern mourning skink * Lissolepis luctuosa (W. Peters, 1866) – western mourning skink, western glossy swamp skink Nota bene: A binomial authority in parentheses indicates that the species was originally described in a genus other than Lissolepis. ==References== Category:Lizard genera Category:Taxa named by Wilhelm Peters
title: Lissolepis
